nodes.bodyText: Typo?
Could you avoid using _ in variable names to avoid Sonar issue?
You can use org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.TitleAreaDialog.setErrorMessage(String) to show error message directly on the dialog.
Could you extract the string to a constant (same remark for below strings)?
This if is not necessary, isn't it?

nodes.bodyText: Utilize constants instead of string keys (ex: "tableTitleBlock")
Remove extra spaces
why rowsNumber is increased? maybe rename the method from refreshTableRows to addNewTableRow.
give a meaningful name instead of "s"
remove extra spaces (also in other places)
Use constants instead of inplace strings, but put an empty string in the constants instead o edit.
same, use constants (empty string)
also create a constant SEPARATOR and put + in it.
put bound 200 in a constant
seems unnecessary, use a constant bounds instead.
new ColumnWeightData - use bound constant maybe

commit.message:
[draft] resolve comments

Change-Id: I8f134538de796ba2d3c9c01be40e884a6f669fd0
Signed-off-by: Malina STOICANESCU <malina.stoicanescu@thalesgroup.com>

nodes.bodyText: Also use constants here.
Remove commented code in the file.
Could you revert this change since there's no real change here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -87,6 +87,7 @@
             name="%ModelValidationPreferencePage_Name">
       </page>
    </extension>
+

nodes.bodyText: Could you revert this change since there's no real change here?
Could you revert this change since there's no real change here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -24,4 +24,3 @@ WizardPreferencePage_Description=Preferences related to Capella Editors
 WizardPreferencePage_Title=Editors

nodes.bodyText: Could you try to use private attributes and get/set methods instead of public attributes?
Could you use the constant instead?
Use equals method instead.  There are many places like this in this class though.

The method name is quite difficult to follow. It does not reflect what it really does. How about changing to something like: addNewEmptyColumn ? And since you have already class-level variables columnsNumber & rowsNumber, do we necessary need input variables here?
Have you tested the cell navigation? I don't see that it works. Using tab switches the selection to other buttons instead of other cells.
If there's no inline editor, you could just return false here.
If there's no inline editor, no need to listen to these events.
why try/catch here?
No need to return here
Remove obsolete code if possible.
